posting_text:
Description:
Develops new, custom web applications using modern web development tools, technologies and
frameworks
Provides maintenance and support services on legacy web applications
Performs all aspects of the software development lifecycle (SDLC)
Able to work with minimal supervision to deliver a quality software product on time and on budget
Able to work independently and with a team
Knack for writing clean, readable and easily maintainable code.
Possesses clear, concise verbal and written communication skills
Possesses a high regard for customer satisfaction
Maintains a positive, can-do attitude, excellent reliability and attendance habits
Receives constructive feedback constructively
Should have excellent documentation skills.
Technical Skills
Expert level Visual Studio .NET and C# experience
Expert level JavaScript experience
Extensive, recent experience with all of the following: Angular JS, TypeScript, NodeJS, ASP.NET 4.0,
MVC, MVVM, Bootstrap, SQL server reporting services, SQL server integration services
Knowledge of and experience with SOAP and REST web services, including experience with
Microsoft WCF
Experience with SharePoint Server 2013
Experience with Team foundation server 2018
Additional Skills Considered a Plus
Experience with Atlassian tools (JIRA)
Experience in training other developers with latest technology.

posting_title: Web Applications Developer: Sacramento County – Department of Child Support Services (DCSS)
posting_text:
Required Skills:

Develop Microsoft ASP.NET, and ASP.NET MVC web applications using C#.
Use Visual Studio for development of .NET projects, and Visual Studio Code for Angular projects.
Work within the project team to complete system analysis, application design and to identify and specify complex business requirements.
Expert knowledge of HTML/HTML5, JavaScript, JSON, and CSS.
Development of RESTful web services using the Microsoft Web API framework with C#.
Develop web applications that interface to RDMS using ADO.NET and Entity Framework.
Participate in a team development environment using the TFS source control system.
Experience working in an agile development environment.

Desired Skills:

Experience with technologies such as ASP.NET Core MVC, Angular and Bootstrap.
Develop single-page-applications using Angular version 6, 7, or 8.
T-SQL for SQL Server and report writing experience, preferably with SSRS
Comfortable working with Observables in JavaScript.
Application Development Lifecycle knowledge and experience.
JIRA tools and API knowledge or experience.
Electronic document management concepts, e.g. imaging, e-signatures.
Building web-based UIs with cross-browser compatibility (IE and Chrome).
Documentation of system support information.
Basic understanding of networking principles.
Ability to analyze system resource usage and constraints.
Recognizes problems, develops recommendations and solutions within assigned specialty.
Works independently and follows through on assignments.

Required Skills:
Minimum 5 years of C#, VB.NET, ASP.NET, ADO.NET experience
Minimum 5 years of Visual Studio 2012 experience
Minimum 5 years of MS SQL Server 2012/2014/2016 experience

Desired Skills:
Visual Basic for Applications (VBA), Windows Batch Scripting experience
Oracle database

Position Requirements:
Design and develop software solutions using the Visual Studio development environment
Complete ALL stages of SDLC including analysis, requirements determination, effort estimation, design, coding, testing, and developing all written technical design, user and end deliverable documentation
Excellent verbal communication skills, ability to work cooperatively with client and team members, provide leadership to ensure successful project execution
Work in a team environment to develop, test, and deploy software changes
Development experience with Health Care Claims processing systems (medical or dental) preferred


Education/Experience:
A technical Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience

Estrada Consulting, Inc. is currently seeking two expert Lead Full-Stack Microservices / .NET Developers for a project located in Sacramento, CA. Candidate will interview in-person.


Candidate will need to be local or within an acceptable commute to work on-site M-F.

Minimum Qualifications and Desired Qualifications:
At least 10 years of verifiable U.S. experience developing enterprise applications based upon Microsoft ASP.NET MVC, Entity Framework, and LINQ. Must have at least 3 years performing in a Lead capacity on large-scale enterprise software development project.
At least 10 years of Front-end development using JavaScript, jQuery, HTML5 and CSS.
At least 5-7 years of Back-end development in C# using ASP.NET MVC.
Must have documented experience in Microservices either AWS or Azure: demonstrated experience building Microservices, patterns etc.
At least 3 years of Database development using MS SQL, including implementing stored procedures, views and managing table schemas and relationships. Proficiency with multi-table joins.
At least 5-7 years
Experience using Visual Studio 2015 or greater, Microsoft SQL Server 2014 or greater, and Microsoft Team Foundation Server 2013 (or similar source control systems).
C#, Razor, JavaScript, jQuery, XML, HTML, CSS, T-SQL.
Verbal and written communication skills need be top notch to effectively communicate with team, project manager, and stakeholders in a diverse team environment.
Object-oriented programming concepts.
Multi-tier/multi-layer software architecture patterns.
Professional experience, and advanced knowledge and skill, in all phases of the software development life cycle (SDLC), including
Analysis and documenting business requirements
Development of technical documentation such as ERDs, DFDs, etc.
Experienced in Agile development and teams.

Desirable Experience:
Public Sector is highly preferred must not mandatory
Microsoft Certifications

About ECI - Sacramento

Estrada Consulting, Inc. (ECI) is a delivering technology-enabled services and solutions to clients all over the USA and British Columbia. We provide system integration, custom application development, project management, custom reporting solutions and consulting services to mid-size and large enterprises in all major industries. The Company headquarters in Sacramento, California, was established in year 2000. Visit http://www.estradaci.com/ to learn about our projects, managed services, awards and certifications delivering value for a range of businesses and government agencies.

posting_title: Full Stack Developer – Contract to Hire
posting_text:
Full Stack Developer – Contract to Hire
This position is a contract to hire role with a local Minnesota based company.
Candidates must be local to the Minneapolis / St. Paul area.


Our client is a member owner network of over 500 members. Their goal is to help their members grow their businesses by providing classroom training, mentoring, online tools, and strategic partnerships.
The big task
We are looking for a full stack developer who can help us transform our digital presence.
Key sub tasks
Create custom applications.
Maintain our websites.
Conduct security assessments.
Build out and customize new platforms.
Skills and experience
BS in computer science or related field(preferred).
5+ years professional experience building web-based applications.
Experience with front-end frameworks (React, Angular, Vue.js).
Strong C#, .Net MVC, EF and/or LAMP stack.
Experience with task management software (e.g. Atlassian Jira).
Experience with version control systems (e.g. ClearCase, Git).
Knowledge of desktop applications such as word processing, spreadsheet and database programs.
Clear understanding of best practices related to defensive coding/security.
Active participation in scrum team with a focus on designing and delivering scalable, modular, responsive applications.

What we offer
Base Salary plus performance bonuses.
Competitive benefits package that includes health and dental insurance, paid time off and tuition reimbursement.
Home service reimbursement.
Gym membership and cell phone reimbursement.
401k Plan.
The opportunity to work with A players who treat each other with respect and integrity.
A family. This is last on the list because it’s most important. We care about our team and expect you to bring that same caring when you join. We do a lot more than just work together. You’ll come to love our company outings, and you’ll build life-long friendships.


** Candidates must be LOCAL to the Minneapolis / St. Paul area. Non-local candidates will not receive a reply **
** No recruiters or placement firms - no response will be given **

*Ability to build web applications including graphic elements, site organization, navigation layout, development, usability of web pages.In depth knowledge of web application development with Angular, HTML5 & CSS3 and Typescript. (other modern frontend JavaScript frameworks such as Ember, Backbone or React can substitute for Angular)Expert knowledge of .NET Core, .NET MVC application development including web servicesStrong foundational understanding of the C# language including usage of Asynchronous programming and Object-Oriented conceptsExperience working with Git or other version control systemsExpertise with SQL and SQL Server databases and Entity FrameworkUnderstanding of unit testing and a desire to write tests and unit testable codeExperience with building microservicesExperience with accessibility standardsTop 3 skills: Angular, .NET, C#Bachelor’s degree – preferably in Computer Science or a similar area; mastery of development skills and demonstrable work experience may substitute for the degree requirementEXAMPLES OF WORK RESPONSIBILITIESDevelop Front End components per UI specification that meet business and technical requirements. This will include working with Business Analysts, Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) and Testers to form a common understanding of the implementation strategy. Work directly with the UI/UX designer to ensure screens match the design.Develop API Components and application tier components including creation or editing of database tables and columns as well as creation or updates to the associated Entity Framework queries, and application endpoints.Create unit tests using xUnit to test all newly developed application components.Perform peer code reviews for the developers on the team as part of the Git pull request process. Peer and architecture reviews will be required, and all application code will be subject to the technical design standards as set by the project requirements and architecture guide.Effective communication style; serve as a collaborative, cooperative and contributing member of the team.Job Type: ContractContract Length:1 yearContract Renewal:LikelyFull Time Opportunity:NoWork Location:One location

About the company: For over 20 years our company has handled the photography and videography of automotive dealership's vehicles for sale on the internet. Our company has several ambitious projects and is expanding to dealerships nationwide with our “self-service” web interface. See our website DealerVision.com for more information about what services our company offers.About the job: We are looking for an experienced and talented C#/.NET developer to join our team in the Granite Bay, CA area. Must be willing and able to work full time, local candidates preferred, but open to remote workers in the same time zone (PST).Principals only, no staffing agencies or software solutions companies.Duties & Responsibilities: Build and enhance multiple database-driven web sites and backend services.Work with staff to design and implement new projects, features, and bug fixes.Develop, debug, and refactor with ASP.NET, C#, MSSQL, Javascript, etc.Qualifications and Skills -- Required: C# and ASP.NETSQL Server, T-SQL, stored proceduresEntity FrameworkProficient in the fundamentals: HTML, JavaScript, CSS, AJAXWorking knowledge of Microsoft Visual StudioGood understanding of OOP, and design patterns (SOLID)Comfortable working with source control repositories (SVN, VSTS/Azure DevOps, git, etc)Team player with excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skillsSelf-starter, driven to deliver quality results quicklyAbility to handle simultaneous projectsDesire and willingness to learn new technologies quicklyOrganized and attentive to detailsStrong work ethicQualifications and Skills -- Preferred: Amazon AWS - S3, EC2, CloudFront, SQS, RDS, Lambda, etc.ASP.NET WebAPIGoogle AnalyticJob Type: Full-timeWork Location:One location

This position will help the team catch up on back log of projects and other application related support tasks. The successful candidate will perform a variety of tasks such as:Work with GIS Web Developers to maintain or create application code using javascript and ArcGIS Services with technologies like C#, CSS, AJAX, Dojo, ArcGIS jsAPI, Google Maps, python and ASP.NET.Experience with Javascript UI frameworks - in particular Bootstrap, also Node, Knockout, Angular, Backbone  * Strong UX skills, particularly for mobileExperience restructuring large scale Javascript applicationsExperience with creating search-centric applications – using SolR, ElasticSearchGIS/Spatial development experience – more than just address points on Google Maps. Use of Google Maps API, ESRI API  * Experience with continuous integration and continuous deployment environmentsExperience with cloud-based application development, deployment and operations  * Work with other division developers to promote geospatial solutions and embed GIS functionality improving customer workflows where it makes sense.This position will be full-time onsite M-F in Sacramento.Job Types: Full-time, ContractSalary: $50.00 to $60.00 /hourEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Location:Sacramento, CA 95814 (Required)Work authorization:United States (Required)Contract Length:More than 1 yearFull Time Opportunity:NoWork Location:One locationBenefits:Health insuranceVisa Sponsorship Potentially Available:No: Not providing sponsorship for this jobThis Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:People-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projectsAchievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might failInnovative -- prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativitySchedule::Monday to Friday

Job Summary.NET Developer with AWSSacramento, CADuration: Long termRequired:Web developer with at least 5 years of experience.Working experience of Angular 2.0 and above, HTML5, JavaScriptC#.net and ADO.net with framework 4.7 and above.Experience developing web APIs (RESTful services)Working knowledge of Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a must.Knowledge of Azure would be an advantage.Knowledge of SQL Server.Net experience that includes design, development, testing, maintenance and production support using SDLC process and Agile methodologies.Good written and oral communication skillsJob Type: ContractExperience:.NET: 2 years (Preferred)mvc: 1 year (Preferred)Contract Renewal:Likely

Who we are:
Since 1998, SambaSafety® has been the pioneer and leading provider of driver risk management software in North America. Our mission is to guide our customers including employers, fleet managers and insurance providers to make the right decision at the right time. By collecting, correlating and analyzing motor vehicle records (MVRs) and other data sources, we identify driver risk and enable our customers to modify their drivers' behavior, reduce accidents, ensure compliance, and lower costs — ultimately improving driver and community safety.
What you'll do
We are looking for a passionate Software Developer to think critically, collaborate with product managers, and guide other engineers while designing, building, and installing software solutions. The successful candidate will be able to build high-quality, innovative and fully performing software in compliance with coding and technical design standards.
3+ years' experience in software development
Write well designed, testable, efficient code
Produce specifications and determine operational feasibility
Integrate software components into a fully functional software system
Develop software verification plans and quality assurance procedures
Document and maintain software functionality
Tailor and deploy software tools, processes and metrics
Serve as a subject matter expert
Comply with project plans and industry standards
 How to step on the accelerator
Hands on experience in designing interactive applications
Ability to develop software in C, C++, C# or other selected languages
Excellent knowledge of Relational Databases, SQL and ORM technologies like Hibernate
Experience in AWS or comparable cloud technologies
Extensive involvement building SOAP-based and REST full web services utilizing WCF/Web API
Experience in developing web applications using at least one popular web framework (ASP.NET MVC, Entity Framework, and LINQ)
Experience with test-driven development
Mastery in software engineering tools
Ability to document requirements and specifications
Familiarity with software development methodology and release processes
Experience working with multi-site and/or offshore teams or team members
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Benefits and Perks:
Unlimited paid time off
Stocked beer fridge (Denver office)*
Healthy snacks provided
Generous insurance policies and amazing benefits
Tuition reimbursement
Career Growth
Money for fitness programs
Awesome Culture
Onsite Fitness Gym and great access to trails
We love to celebrate birthdays!
Kitchen stocked daily with tasty snacks and drinks
Garage parking for Employees*
Matching 401kAvailable in certain office locations
SambaSafety provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, gender identity, and expression or genetics.

Recruiters please do not contact this job poster.Do NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offer.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $55,000.00 /yearExperience:relevant: 1 year (Preferred)Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Work Location:One locationMultiple locationsBenefits:Paid time offRelocation assistanceProfessional development assistanceHealth insuranceThis Job Is:Open to applicants who do not have a college diplomaOpen to applicants who do not have a high school diploma/GEDA job for which military experienced candidates are encouraged to applySchedule::Monday to Friday

Role:  Senior SQL DeveloperLocation:  Sacramento, CADuration:  24 months (extendable by another 12 months)Mandatory Technical RequirementAt least eight (8) years of experience comprehending and developing complex SQL queries; developing detailed SQL reporting specifications, analyzing, validating, and / or reconciling data from heterogeneous data sources such as mainframe, MS SQL Server, MS Access databases, csv files, text files.At least eight (8) years of experience designing, developing, debugging and supporting complex data validation processes (including stored procedures, tables, user defined functions, views, indexes, relational database models) using various tools and technologies including SSRS, T-SQL and SQL Server technology. This experience must include full-time experience in developing reports and writing code from data model, dataflow diagram and technical design specifications.At least six (6) years of experience performing data migration efforts including analysis, cleansing, conversion, verification and validation to ensure data quality and consistency.At least five (5) years of experience analyzing functional and nonfunctional data conversion requirements, data conversion mapping code and transformation rules for translating them into technical requirements for data quality assurance purposes including but not limited to the performing validation using reconciliation methods of checking record counts between source and target systems.Desirable Technical RequirementsAt least five (5) years of experience in developing SQL Reports as part of the data validation strategy for a Pension Administration System.At least five (5) years of experience with Microsoft.Net framework using languages such as C# and VB.Net to write utilities for validating data as well as source code management software such as TFS (Microsoft Team Foundation Server).At least five (5) years of experience in validating data being converted from legacy mainframe applications to SQL Server.At least five (5) years of experience in producing the following documents: data verification & validation requirements, data validation strategy, data validation test cases and data validation reports.At least two (2) years of experience handling Database Administrator (DBA) tasks using MS SQL Server.A four-year college degree (Bachelor) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related fields from a government accredited/sanctioned college or university.Job Type: ContractContract Renewal:PossibleWork Location:One location
